se.bricole.xss.server
Class Server

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--se.bricole.xss.server.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, ServerManager, SessionEventListener
public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements SessionEventListener, java.lang.Runnable, ServerManager

This is the class containing the "main" method, and is responsible for accepting and allocating incoming connections as well as garbage-collecting old ClientProxies and idle clients.

Version:
$Id: Server.java,v 1.5 2002/09/14 17:07:42 gray Exp $

gc

_gc

protected void _gc()

run

public void run()
This is the garbage collector thread (which also serves the optional status messages). Every GCInterval (configuration value) seconds, the garbage collector is run. The garbage collector is responsible for dereferencing any ClientProxy object without clients, and closing connections which have been idle for too long (configuration option "ClientIdleTimeout"). Also, the GC traverses the thread pool to see if there are any dead threads in the pool; in that case, it replaces them with new pooled threads.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

Returns the uptime of the server in milliseconds

debug

public static final void debug(java.lang.Object o,
                               java.lang.String s)
Used to debug client communication. Prints out client information (ClientConnection.toString()) along with a timestamp and the supplied String to stdout.

fatal

public static void fatal(java.lang.String s)
This method should be called when an unrecoverable error has been encountered and execution cannot (or should not) continue. An error message will me printed on stderr and the JVM will exit.

broadcast

public void broadcast(ClientSession source,
                      java.lang.String msg,
                      boolean override)
Broadcast message "msg" originating from "source" to _all_ clients. If "override" is true, all clients will receive the message, regardless of the connections' "receiveBroadcasts" property. If the server is heavily loaded, use this method with care.
